activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S. Boldt

records.addlTxt:
8:41 AM  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Christopher S. Boldt. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF184, 22TR1577 & 22TR1607. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 08:43 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:06 PM Defendant Christopher S. Boldt in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Christopher S. Boldt.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Also calling 22tr1577 22TR1607
In receipt, waive reading. Set for preliminary hearing. 
Bail continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No intoxicants/No taverns/The defendant is required to be monitored by the SCRAM bracelet through ADL Monitoring Solutions. The defendant is ordered to make appointment with ADL before release from jail and be equipment with SCRAM bracelet before release. The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the SCRAM bracelet.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher S. Boldt appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF184 & 22TR1577. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Sowinski/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond - will address status of ADL tomorrow. adj. 01:40 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
